intro: Crotalaria abbreviata, commonly known as the dwarf cowpea or smallleaf cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seeds are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines, while the plant also has medicinal properties in some cultures.
